intro: Oncinotis melanocephala, commonly known as black-headed onion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces a tall, slender stem that bears a single, showy purple or violet flower. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Oncinotis melanocephala is adapted to drought conditions and is typically in bloom from spring to early summer.
